verses.verse: Yahweh<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses<WH4872> and to Aaron,<WH175> saying,<WH559>

"When a man<WH120> shall have a rising<WH7613> in his body<WH1320>'s skin,<WH5785> or a scab,<WH5597> or a bright spot,<WH934> and it becomes in the skin<WH5785> of his body<WH1320> the plague<WH5061> of leprosy,<WH6883> then he shall be brought<WH935> to Aaron<WH175> the priest,<WH3548> or to one<WH259> of his sons,<WH1121> the priests:<WH3548>

and the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> the plague<WH5061> in the skin<WH5785> of the body:<WH1320> and if the hair<WH8181> in the plague<WH5061> has turned<WH2015> white,<WH3836> and the appearance<WH4758> of the plague<WH5061> is deeper<WH6013> than the body<WH1320>'s skin,<WH5785> it is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy;<WH6883> and the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him,<WH2930> and pronounce him unclean.

If the bright spot<WH934> is white<WH3836> in the skin<WH5785> of his body,<WH1320> and its appearance<WH4758> isn't<WH6013> deeper than the skin,<WH5785> and its hair<WH8181> hasn't<WH2015> turned white,<WH3836> then the priest<WH3548> shall isolate<WH5462> the infected<WH5061> person for seven<WH7651> days.<WH3117>

The priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him on the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> and,<WH5869> behold, if in his eyes the plague<WH5061> is arrested,<WH5975> and the plague<WH5061> hasn't<WH6581> spread in the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall isolate<WH5462> him for seven<WH7651> more<WH8145> days.<WH3117>

The priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him again<WH8145> on the seventh<WH7637> day;<WH3117> and behold,<WH5061> if the plague has faded,<WH3544> and the plague<WH5061> hasn't<WH6581> spread in the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean.<WH2891> It is a scab.<WH4556> He shall wash<WH3526> his clothes,<WH899> and be clean.<WH2891>

But if the scab<WH4556> spreads<WH6581> on<WH6581> the skin,<WH5785> after<WH310> he has shown<WH7200> himself to the priest<WH3548> for his cleansing,<WH2893> he shall show<WH7200> himself to the priest<WH3548> again.<WH8145>

The priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him;<WH7200> and behold, if the scab<WH4556> has spread on the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean.<WH2930> It is leprosy.<WH6883>
"When the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> is in a man,<WH120> then he shall be brought<WH935> to the priest;<WH3548>

and the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him.<WH3836> Behold, if there is a white rising<WH7613> in the skin,<WH5785> and it has turned<WH2015> the hair<WH8181> white,<WH3836> and there is<WH4241> raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> in the rising,<WH7613>

it is a chronic<WH3462> leprosy<WH6883> in the skin<WH5785> of his body,<WH1320> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean.<WH2930> He shall not isolate<WH5462> him,<WH2931> for he is unclean.

"If the leprosy<WH6883> breaks out<WH6524> all over<WH6524> the skin,<WH5785> and the leprosy<WH6883> covers<WH3680> all the skin<WH5785> of the infected<WH5061> person from his head<WH7218> even to his feet,<WH7272> as far as it appears<WH4758> to the priest;<WH3548>

then the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him;<WH6883> and, behold, if the leprosy has covered<WH3680> all his flesh,<WH1320> he shall pronounce him clean<WH2891> of the plague.<WH5061> It has all turned<WH2015> white:<WH3836> he is clean.<WH2889>
But whenever<WH3117> raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> appears<WH7200> in him,<WH2930> he shall be unclean.
The priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> the raw<WH2416> flesh,<WH1320> and pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> the raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> is unclean.<WH2930> It is leprosy.<WH6883>
Or if the raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> turns again,<WH7725> and is changed<WH2015> to white,<WH3836> then he shall come<WH935> to the priest;<WH3548>

and the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him;<WH5061> and, behold, if the plague has turned<WH2015> white,<WH3836> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891> of the plague.<WH5061> He is clean.<WH2891>
"When the body<WH1320> has a boil<WH7822> on its<WH3588> skin,<WH5785> and it has healed,<WH7495>
and in the place<WH4725> of the boil<WH7822> there is a white<WH3836> rising,<WH7613> or a bright spot,<WH934> reddish<WH125> - white,<WH3836> then it shall be shown<WH7200> to the priest;<WH3548>

and the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> it;<WH4758> and behold, if its appearance is lower<WH8217> than the skin,<WH5785> and its hair<WH8181> has turned<WH2015> white,<WH3836> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean.<WH2930> It is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy.<WH6883> It has broken<WH6524> out in the boil.<WH7822>

But if the priest<WH3548> examines<WH7200> it,<WH3836> and behold, there are no white hairs<WH8181> in it,<WH8217> and it isn't deeper than the skin,<WH5785> but is dim,<WH3544> then the priest<WH3548> shall isolate<WH5462> him seven<WH7651> days.<WH3117>
If it spreads<WH6581> in<WH6581> the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean.<WH2930> It is a plague.<WH5061>
But if the bright spot<WH934> stays<WH5975> in its place,<WH6581> and hasn't spread, it is the scar<WH6867> from the boil;<WH7822> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean.<WH2891>

"Or when the body<WH1320> has a burn<WH4348> from fire<WH784> on its skin,<WH5785> and the raw<WH4241> flesh of the burn<WH4348> becomes a bright<WH3836> spot,<WH934> reddish-white,<WH125> or white,<WH3836>

then the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> it;<WH8181> and behold, if the hair in the bright spot<WH934> has turned<WH2015> white,<WH3836> and its appearance<WH4758> is deeper<WH6013> than the skin;<WH5785> it is leprosy.<WH6883> It has broken<WH6524> out in the burning,<WH4348> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean.<WH2930> It is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy.<WH6883>

But if the priest<WH3548> examines<WH7200> it,<WH3836> and behold, there is no white hair<WH8181> in the bright spot,<WH934> and it isn't<WH8217> lower than the skin,<WH5785> but is faded;<WH3544> then the priest<WH3548> shall isolate<WH5462> him seven<WH7651> days.<WH3117>

The priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him on the seventh<WH7637> day.<WH3117> If it has spread<WH6581> in<WH6581> the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean.<WH2930> It is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy.<WH6883>

If the bright<WH934> spot<WH934> stays<WH5975> in its place,<WH6581> and hasn't spread in the skin,<WH5785> but is faded,<WH3544> it is the swelling<WH7613> from the burn,<WH4348> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean;<WH2891> for it is the scar<WH6867> from the burn.<WH4348>
"When a man<WH376> or woman<WH802> has a plague<WH5061> on the head<WH7218> or on the beard,<WH2206>

then the priest<WH3548> shall examine the plague;<WH5061> and behold,<WH7200> if its appearance<WH4758> is deeper<WH6013> than the skin,<WH5785> and the hair<WH8181> in it is yellow<WH6669> and thin,<WH1851> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> it is an itch,<WH5424> it is leprosy<WH6883> of the head<WH7218> or of the beard.<WH2206>

If the priest<WH3548> examines<WH7200> the plague<WH5061> of itching,<WH5424> and behold,<WH4758> its appearance isn't<WH6013> deeper than the skin,<WH5785> and there is no black<WH7838> hair<WH8181> in it,<WH3548> then the priest shall isolate<WH5462> him the person infected<WH5061> with itching<WH5424> seven<WH7651> days.<WH3117>

On the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> the plague;<WH5061> and behold,<WH5424> if the itch hasn't<WH6581> spread, and there is no yellow<WH6669> hair<WH8181> in it,<WH4758> and the appearance of the itch<WH5424> isn't<WH6013> deeper than the skin,<WH5785>
then he shall be shaved,<WH1548> but he shall not shave<WH1548> the itch;<WH5424> and the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> him up who has the itch<WH5424> seven<WH7651> more<WH8145> days.<WH3117>

On the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> the itch;<WH5424> and behold,<WH5424> if the itch hasn't<WH6581> spread in the skin,<WH5785> and its appearance<WH4758> isn't<WH6013> deeper than the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean.<WH2891> He shall wash<WH3526> his clothes,<WH899> and be clean.<WH2891>
But if the itch<WH5424> spreads<WH6581> in<WH6581> the skin<WH5785> after<WH310> his cleansing,<WH2893>

then the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him;<WH5424> and behold, if the itch has spread<WH6581> in the skin,<WH5785> the priest<WH3548> shall not look<WH1239> for the yellow<WH6669> hair;<WH8181> he is unclean.<WH2931>

But if in his eyes<WH5869> the itch<WH5424> is arrested,<WH5975> and black<WH7838> hair<WH8181> has grown<WH6779> in it;<WH5424> the itch is healed,<WH7495> he is clean.<WH2889> The priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean.<WH2889>
"When a man<WH376> or a woman<WH802> has bright spots<WH934> in the skin<WH5785> of the body,<WH1320> even white<WH3836> bright spots;<WH934>

then the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> them;<WH934> and behold, if the bright spots on the skin<WH5785> of their body<WH1320> are a dull<WH3544> white,<WH3836> it is a harmless rash,<WH933> it has broken<WH6524> out in the skin;<WH5785> he is clean.<WH2889>
"If a man<WH376>'s hair has fallen<WH4803> from his head,<WH7218> he is bald.<WH7142> He is clean.<WH2889>
If his hair has fallen<WH4803> off from the front part<WH6285> of his head,<WH7218> he is forehead bald.<WH1371> He is clean.<WH2889>

But if there is in the bald head,<WH7146> or the bald forehead,<WH1372> a reddish<WH125> - white<WH3836> plague;<WH5061> it is leprosy<WH6883> breaking<WH6524> out in his bald head,<WH7146> or his bald forehead.<WH1372>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> him;<WH7613> and, behold, if the rising of the plague<WH5061> is reddish<WH125> - white<WH3836> in his bald head,<WH7146> or in his bald forehead,<WH1372> like the appearance<WH4758> of leprosy<WH6883> in the skin<WH5785> of the flesh,<WH1320>
he is a leprous<WH6879> man.<WH376> He is unclean.<WH2931> The priest<WH3548> shall surely pronounce him<WH2930> unclean.<WH2930> His plague<WH5061> is on his head.<WH7218>

"The leper<WH6879> in whom the plague<WH5061> is shall wear torn<WH6533> clothes,<WH899> and the hair of his head<WH7218> shall hang loose.<WH6544> He shall cover<WH5844> his upper lip,<WH8222> and shall cry,<WH7121> <WH2931> 'Unclean! Unclean!<WH2931>'

All the days<WH3117> in which the plague<WH5061> is in him he shall be unclean.<WH2930> He is unclean.<WH2931> He shall dwell<WH3427> alone.<WH910> Outside<WH2351> of the camp<WH4264> shall be his dwelling.<WH4186>
"The garment<WH899> also that the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> is in,<WH6785> whether it is a woolen garment,<WH899> or a linen<WH6593> garment;<WH899>
whether it is in warp,<WH8359> or woof;<WH6154> of linen,<WH6593> or of wool;<WH6785> whether in a skin,<WH5785> or in anything made<WH4399> of skin;<WH5785>

if the plague<WH5061> is greenish<WH3422> or reddish<WH125> in the garment,<WH899> or in the skin,<WH5785> or<WH176> in the warp,<WH8359> or in the woof,<WH6154> or in anything<WH3627> made of skin;<WH5785> it is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy,<WH6883> and shall be shown<WH7200> to the priest.<WH3548>
The priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> the plague,<WH5061> and isolate<WH5462> the plague<WH5061> seven<WH7651> days.<WH3117>

He shall examine<WH7200> the plague<WH5061> on the seventh<WH7637> day.<WH3117> If the plague<WH5061> has spread<WH6581> in the garment,<WH899> either in the warp,<WH8359> or in the woof,<WH6154> or in the skin,<WH5785> whatever use<WH4399> the skin<WH5785> is used<WH6213> for,<WH5061> the plague is a destructive<WH3992> mildew.<WH6883> It is unclean.<WH2931>

He shall burn<WH8313> the garment,<WH899> whether the warp<WH8359> or the woof,<WH6154> in wool<WH6785> or in linen,<WH6593> or anything<WH3627> of skin,<WH5785> in which the plague<WH5061> is:<WH3992> for it is a destructive mildew.<WH6883> It shall be burned<WH8313> in the fire.<WH784>

"If the priest<WH3548> examines<WH7200> it,<WH5061> and behold, the plague hasn't<WH6581> spread in the garment,<WH899> either<WH176> in the warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> in the woof,<WH6154> or<WH176> in anything<WH3627> of skin;<WH5785>
then the priest<WH3548> shall command<WH6680> that they wash<WH3526> the thing in which the plague<WH5061> is,<WH5462> and he shall isolate it seven<WH7651> more<WH8145> days.<WH3117>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall examine<WH7200> it,<WH310> after the plague<WH5061> is washed;<WH3526> and behold,<WH5061> if the plague hasn't<WH2015> changed its color,<WH5869> and the plague<WH5061> hasn't<WH6581> spread, it is unclean;<WH2931> you shall burn<WH8313> it in the fire.<WH784> It is a mildewed<WH6356> spot,<WH7146> whether the bareness is inside or outside.<WH1372>

If the priest<WH3548> looks,<WH7200> and behold,<WH5061> the plague has faded<WH3544> after<WH310> it is washed,<WH3526> then he shall tear<WH7167> it out of the garment,<WH899> or out of the skin,<WH5785> or out of the warp,<WH8359> or out of the woof:<WH6154>

and if it appears<WH7200> again<WH5750> in the garment,<WH899> either in the warp,<WH8359> or in the woof,<WH6154> or in anything<WH3627> of skin,<WH5785> it is spreading.<WH6524> You shall burn<WH8313> with fire<WH784> that in which the plague is.<WH5061>

The garment,<WH899> either the warp,<WH8359> or the woof,<WH6154> or whatever thing<WH3627> of skin<WH5785> it is,<WH3526> which you shall wash, if the plague<WH5061> has departed<WH5493> from them,<WH3526> then it shall be washed the second<WH8145> time,<WH2891> and it will be clean."

This is the law<WH8451> of the plague<WH5061> of mildew<WH6883> in a garment<WH899> of wool<WH6785> or linen,<WH6593> either in the warp,<WH8359> or the woof,<WH6154> or in anything<WH3627> of skin,<WH5785> to pronounce it clean,<WH2891> or to pronounce it unclean.<WH2930>
